descriptionSet.description: On this page from a brochure advertising the Hindi movie "Patanga" from 1971, three of the leading actors, probably Shashi Kapoor, Vimi and Ajit can be seen. Shashi Kapoor is pictured in a red drop. The name of the movie is written in Hindi as well as Urdu.

inscription.text: K.R. Films' Patanga in Eastmancolor Directed by Kedar Kapoor Music Shanker Jaikishan Screenplay & Dialogue Pt. Mukhram Sharma Produced by Kedar Kapoor + R.S. Sharma

location.name: Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art
Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art

hra:item.hra:value: text-en: K.R. Films' Patanga in Eastmancolor Directed by Kedar Kapoor Music Shanker Jaikishan Screenplay & Dialogue Pt. Mukhram Sharma Produced by Kedar Kapoor + R.S. Sharma

description-en: On this page from a brochure advertising the Hindi movie "Patanga" from 1971, three of the leading actors, probably Shashi Kapoor, Vimi and Ajit can be seen. Shashi Kapoor is pictured in a red drop. The name of the movie is written in Hindi as well as Urdu. (gs)

explanatory comments/crosstagging: Story line of the movie: In order to reward Ramu for loyally serving his family for many years, Amar Singh undertakes to treat Ramu's son, Shyam, as his younger brother, ensures that he has a good education in a college in Dehradun, and even made plans with Manoharlal to send him abroad for further studies. When Manoharlal unexpectedly passes away, he permits the later's wife, Kanta and her son, Pappu; an elderly aunt and her son, Kuldeep; and unmarried sister, Renu, to move in with him in his mansion. He falls in love with Renu and plans to marry her much to the chagrin of Thakur Chandan Singh, who had planned to get his sister, Rajkumari, married to him, and was offended when Amar suggested that she be married to Shyam instead. Before he could handle this animosity, he and Ramu will have to deal with an unexpected situation that will involve a courtesan named Champa. http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0232288/ (gs)
explanatory comments/crosstagging: The yellow field behind the drop in which Shashi Kapoor is pictured looks like the shape of a country or district being depicted on a map. (gs)
related hyperlinks: http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0232288/, last accessed 2012-01-16, story plot, leading actors (gs)
